So am I reading right here, that we will get an Icon after 100 matchmade wins on Dominion, so Custom games don't count, only games where we've queued. 

Thats ridiculous when we haven't had the option to queue for it on Oce..... Riot needs to at least respect that Oce players in the past 2~~ years couldn't possibly have achieved that, and its not like we haven't been vocal about wanting Dominion as a queue. 

At least make the game mode available in the coming weeks, or make the reward more available to players who have always wanted Dominion but haven't got it because of Oce Riot.

OCE is a unique situation, and we hear you guys. Unlike players from other regions who never experienced Dominion, we know that some of you guys came over from NA and may have played it there. We went the extra mile for you guys, digging into account history pre-transfer to **ensure** those of you who were hardcore Dominion players over on NA beforehand will still get the icon. <3

The icon is intended to represent the commitment those players with 100, 500, or even a 1000+ wins invested into the map. They spent their precious time playing it, and we want to recognise that. 

We appreciate that given the opportunity, players in Philippines, LATAM, OCE, or other servers without Dominion _might_ have played it a little bit (although performance in other regions is fairly telling), but today the icon is about reward and recognition for the people who _did_ invest their time, whatever server they may be on.

"OCE is a unique situation, and we hear you guys."

If you had heard us you would have brought back Dominion matchmaking as a seasonal mode, like people keep asking.


"Unlike players from other regions who never experienced Dominion, we know that some of you guys came over from NA and may have played it there"

NA was one of the only servers, most people who played League prior to OCE's release in 2013 played on NA's server. Also, anyone who started on the OCE server never experienced it, you have a server with tens maybe hundreds upon thousands of people who never had a chance to play it outside of custom who want to play it and were never given the chance.


"today the icon is about reward and recognition for the people who did invest their time, whatever server they may be on."

Then why did they need 100 wins, from a game mode that's been down for probably more than the three years. If it's rewarding people for playing it, just give it to them for playing it, not winning 100 games of it. Also, what about the people that didn't get 100 wins and are close to it, just "Goodbye, tough luck and get stuffed"?


How hard is it to set up a "Going away week" for a game mode that you're about to remove forever. It would probably get played more for that last week than normal 5v5. Those numbers you've been chasing would also look better if it was a seasonal event along with the other game modes.

I don't think you'll find many people that would agree that this mode and map should just disappear without some lime light before it dies.
Bro, buy a transfer to NA, play 100 games, transfer back to OCE. Easy as. It'll only cost you about $50 and countless hours of your life you'll never get back :)
Bro, its only an icon.
Its more about the principle of offering a reward that we literally cant have gotten over the past two years, despite consistently asking for a dominion queue.
I agree, OCE hasn't even had an option to Que for Dominion which makes it unfair for the players that aren't able to get reward. Icon or not it's unfair that we don't get a chance to earn it.

Honestly this is just dumb. I have 93 wins on dominion (from NA), and I bet the majority have a lot less. Most people will have none because we've never even HAD dominion. My suggestion would be to have a featured dominion game-mode in the coming weeks, and if you win a game you get the icon (like all other featured modes).

TY Hide and Seek

TL;DR RIP fun and custom gamemodes.

This is so very disappointing. To be honest, for the past couple years its seemed as if all the fun is being taken out of league as you try to make it a more *professional* game. You released different modes and maps to encourage different types of game play a fun events in the past, but now its just re-released content for a measly 2 weeks out of 2 months on average. You release more champions, but generally its been much of a muchness for the past 2 years with no major break through's. a couple changes have affected the numbers of the game, what with mastery changes and the like, but the game hasn't changed for a LONG time. You say that alternative game modes are better in short bursts, which is true if you simply looking at the more serious gameplay element. But many people don't play league to be serious, these are the people who go to custom game to have fun and play hide and seek and various other custom games which are based on a smaller map. As someone previously mentioned on here, you retired Dominion when you removed the game queue for it on OCE, but you buried the body when you remove it completely. 

For the small hope I have inside me that Riot hasn't lost all of its sense of fun and joy in the past, please, please find some way to host silly or non-serious games in some form regularly. 2 weeks in a blue moon is not enough for people who just want to have a laugh and relax. In fact these types of games thrive in a custom environment and not in matchmade gameplay, so it doesn't have to be serious and well maintained. If it can work 90% of the time in customs, then people will be happy. 

As some ides for how this could work, Perhaps have a dedicated smaller arena so that we can still enjoy some of the custom games that even on OCE are still regularly hosted such as hide and seek, and in the past, teamfight arena(but considering the retirement of dominion, i can see that you guys don't want any branching out from main product. sad, i know, because its costing and going to cost you players in the long run)

Perhaps allow the flavor of the month game mode(such as doom bots/URF ect) to be played in a custom environment. That way it allows communities to still enjoy your content, and if certain aspect get broken then it doesn't matter. People will share information about whats broken and avoid the mistakes. Hell, put up a disclaimer for people to sign saying that they cant complain if somethings broken on it. 

If you look at many many other games in the DOTA style (I refuse to call them mobas) and other popular games that have long term players, they always have regular fun content. Lets just list some for reference (non mobas so riot fun police doesn't get pissy). Hearthstone has tavern brawls about 4.5 days/7. A certain moba that sounds like s'right has daily alternative game modes.

And these custom game modes always teach some skill or another to players without the seriousness of Summoners rift normals and ranked. ARAMs taught how to dodge and better aiming skill shots (and this was way before the actual map made for it) Hide and seek, depending on the team you were on, made you better at (obviously) hiding, duking, using vision to your advantage and escaping if you were a hider. If you were a seeker it really encouraged proper teamwork elements, even when some plat+ players would join who never played before would be a terrible seeker because they became so solo focused and weren't good at working duo play. Now these are just examples, but this type of fun used to be a priority at riot, but now its just new skin woo, new champion who is just a mix of the abilities from other champions thrown together woo, new icon woo, there's no change in play from league and it stagnates for older players. Many of my friends have quit league because it doesn't change and there's no fun, there's no place for non serious play or off builds or anything anymore, leaving just optimization of the strongest champions until you miss something else broken then optimize them.

...don't let me get started on the build limitation of so many champions. I recognize the need for champions to not be able to build and change their method of play based on build because on the unbalanced nature of that ability and unfairness it can bring in a serious ranked environment, look at ez and so many that were changed because overall its just too hard to balance correctly. I can understand, but I don't have to like the railroaded nature of builds right now.
So this is an insane rant and I apologize to anyone who actually read it. Here's to you kid.

You retired Dominion ages ago Riot, sticking it in Custom was retiring it. This is burying the body.

While I'm not a fan of it having been put in the back room, I think it should be an event that everyone can enjoy for it's last week with us.

You probably don't even really care but I just came here to say my piece.

I still think Rito should take a page out of Blizzards book and introduce Tavern Brawls, once a week/fortnight have a different game mode become available for a short period of time. This could include Dominion, URF, All for One, Hexakill, Ultimate Bravery etc.

Dear Riot,
Sorry if I sound rude and out of line but this is absolutely disgusting. What are you guys actually thinking? I just can't believe that I have been waiting all these years, coming over from NA, to be finally told that I can't play this game mode. 

What? 

I'm upset that players on OCE are not given a daily availability to play in normal queues with this game mode but are being punished because of these statistics. If people are not allowed the chance to play, how do you expect them to play? 

For example: when the game mode Ascension was going on, there were so many people in the queues because a) It was a great game mode and b) it provided PvP on the Crystal Scar. This event showed that players of the OCE community, if given the opportunity, will play on Crystal Scar. But hey, what does that matter now? 

Permanently disabling Dominion and removing Crystal Scar from custom game modes I personally believe is a step too far in the wrong direction. Please reconsider the decision made for this situation by acknowledging our thoughts and feelings. Thanks.

Your own employee got downvoted to oblivion for offering an explanation.

Imagine you get your mate a present. You hand it over to them, but it's locked up and they're waiting for you to give them the key. They're sitting, playing with the gift wrapping, waiting. And waiting. And waiting.

Then you throw the present away because they never bothered to use it. While it was still locked.

When you never make a gamemode available, you can't then turn around and say nobody ever plays it.

It's NEVER BEEN AVAILABLE.

Of course the number is low, nobody on the server has ever had the chance to try it as Dominion. The map has only ever been allowed as ascension or custom games a.k.a hide and seek. If you had released Dominion for a trial run to gauge community interest, it'd be understandable. But taking away something we never had and saying we didn't use it...you never gave it to us in the first place.
